cycloneMessage.issuingUnit: NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL
cycloneMessage.systemGeoRefPt1: ABOUT 1290 MI...2075 KM WSW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA
cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP3 ALL TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM
BULLETIN Hurricane Kenneth Advisory Number 10 NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL EP132017 200 PM PDT Sun Aug 20 2017
...KENNETH RAPIDLY STRENGTHENING AND IS NOW NEAR CATEGORY 2 STRENGTH...
SUMMARY OF 200 PM PDT...2100 UTC...INFORMATION ---------------------------------------------- LOCATION...16.2N 128.4W ABOUT 1290 MI...2075 KM WSW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...90 MPH...150 KM/H PRESENT MOVEMENT...W OR 280 DEGREES AT 14 MPH...22 KM/H MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...980 MB...28.94 INCHES
WATCHES AND WARNINGS -------------------- There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK ------------------------------ At 200 PM PDT (2100 UTC), the center of Hurricane Kenneth was located near latitude 16.2 North, longitude 128.4 West. Kenneth is moving toward the west near 14 mph (22 km/h). A slower west-northwestward motion is expected later today, and a turn toward the northwest is forecast to occur on Monday.
Maximum sustained winds have increased to near 90 mph (150 km/h) with higher gusts. Additional strengthening is forecast during the next day or so, but weakening should commence by Monday night.
Hurricane-force winds extend outward up to 25 miles (35 km) from the center and tropical-storm-force winds extend outward up to 90 miles (150 km).
The estimated minimum central pressure is 980 mb (28.94 inches).
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND ---------------------- None
NEXT ADVISORY ------------- Next complete advisory at 800 PM PDT.
$$ Forecaster Cangialosi
NNNN
